decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent. By using cheap spells like Brainstorm, Daze, Force of Will, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage to the opponent efficiently. Utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble, Ponder, and Stock Up help the deck maintain card advantage and consistency. The mana base consists of efficient lands like Island','','');">Volcanic Island and Wasteland to support the aggressive playstyle of the deck.

The key focus of this deck is to utilize green creatures with powerful abilities to quickly overwhelm your opponent. By accelerating mana with cards like Ignoble Hierarch and Gaea's Cradle, you can quickly summon large threats like Wight of the Reliquary and Barrowgoyf. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Collector Ouphe to control your opponent's resources. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to maintain constant pressure on your opponent while disrupting their game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy artifact creatures and utilize powerful artifact spells to overwhelm the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch serves as a key engine for recurring artifacts from the graveyard, while Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer provide aggressive threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to control the game. Urza's Saga is a key land that can create artifact tokens and tutor for important artifacts. Overall, the strategy revolves around utilizing artifacts efficiently to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements like counterspells and removal alongside efficient threats like Stoneforge Mystic and Murktide Regent to disrupt the opponent and gradually gain advantage. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler adds additional card advantage and versatility to the deck's game plan. The mana base is carefully curated to ensure consistency and stability, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to support the deck's color requirements. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control and proactive threats.

The key concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with efficient removal and counter spells. Utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and come out on top. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage, while cards like Daze and Force of Will protect our threats and disrupt the opponent's plays. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly applying pressure with efficient creatures. Utilizing a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game. The inclusion of Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent provides a clock for the opponent to race against, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student generates card advantage and Barrowgoyf grows in power as the game progresses. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining a fast clock to close out the game.

The key concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing efficient creatures and spells to apply pressure and control the tempo of the game. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while deploying threats like Katara, Waterbending Master and Murktide Regent to quickly close out the game. The deck aims to maintain board presence and card advantage, while efficiently removing threats through cards like Fatal Push and Snuff Out. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game and punishing the opponent's missteps.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and other counterspells, the deck aims to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Utilizing mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, the deck is focused on quickly getting its key combo pieces into play to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a fast and explosive manner.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly play out artifact creatures and utilize Emry, Lurker of the Loch's ability to recur artifacts from the graveyard. By combining aggressive artifact creatures with powerful artifact synergies like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient aggro strategy while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor. The inclusion of cards like Memory Guardian and Pinnacle Emissary provides additional utility and versatility to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on using powerful control cards to outvalue opponents while having access to a companion for additional value. It includes various ways to control the board with counterspells and removal, alongside powerful threats such as Quantum Riddler and Murktide Regent. The deck also utilizes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to maintain a steady stream of resources. Additionally, the deck includes a versatile sideboard to adapt to different matchups and situations.

The focus of this deck is to efficiently and effectively utilize the powerful Doomsday card to set up a winning combination. By using cards such as Brainstorm, Ponder, and Thoughtseize to sculpt the perfect hand, and mana acceleration like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, players can quickly assemble the necessary cards for victory. With the backup of Force of Will for protection and disruption provided by Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent, this deck aims to create a precise and lethal sequence of cards to secure a win.

This deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly with dredge creatures and using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough to draw through the deck. The key strategy is to trigger abilities from cards like Narcomoeba and Bridge from Below to create a large army of zombies and overwhelm the opponent. Using Lion's Eye Diamond and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to win by either milling themselves out with Thassa's Oracle or reanimating a large creature with Dread Return for a lethal attack.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to utilize fast mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to cast big threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher ahead of curve. The inclusion of Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin further supports the strategy of deploying Eldrazi creatures efficiently. Additionally, the deck includes disruption with cards like Wasteland and Kozilek's Command to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly establish a powerful board presence with efficient Eldrazi creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland. By utilizing mana acceleration such as Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith, the deck can deploy threats ahead of schedule and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game by leveraging the strengths of the Eldrazi tribe in a Legacy format 1 vs 1 match.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands and various disruptive elements to slow down the opponent's strategy. By using cards like Mox Diamond, Life from the Loam, and Exploration, the deck aims to create a strong land base while disrupting the opponent with Wasteland and Pithing Needle. The win condition of the deck revolves around assembling the Dark Depths-Thespian's Stage combo to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game through strategic land plays and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to quickly and efficiently generate a large amount of mana and cards through spells like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond before using Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in one explosive turn. The deck also utilizes cards like Veil of Summer and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo. With tutors like Infernal Tutor and Wishclaw Talisman, the deck is able to search for key combo pieces and consistently execute its game plan. Additionally, cards like Ad Nauseam and Gaea's Will provide additional avenues for achieving victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and other lands, while utilizing a combination of powerful cards such as Karn, the Great Creator and Eldrazi to create a dominant board presence. The deck also incorporates disruption spells like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to control the opponent's plays. Additionally, cards like Thundertrap Trainer and The One Ring provide additional win conditions and utility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of mana acceleration and powerful threats in order to secure victory.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro-Artifacts Blue deck is to quickly deploy artifact creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Patchwork Automaton, while disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Pithing Needle. The deck also utilizes powerful mana accelerants such as Mox Opal and Lotus Petal to ramp into threats and take advantage of the artifact synergies. By combining efficient threats with disruptive elements and fast mana, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a proactive game plan centered around artifact creatures and powerful artifacts.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With powerful support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison provide additional versatility and controlling elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Lastly, the deck utilizes the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring to provide additional value and flexibility in its gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive creatures. By combining cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Fatal Push with threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Yorion, Sky Nomad, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. The deck also has a strong mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the right colors of mana for its spells.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Llanowar Elves and Gaea's Cradle to bring out powerful creatures like Allosaurus Shepherd and Craterhoof Behemoth. It also relies on control elements like Orcish Bowmasters and Collector Ouphe to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to outpace the opponent in mana production and overwhelm them with a quick and powerful board presence, using cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to search for key creatures. Ultimately, the goal is to control the game and win through sheer force and efficient use of resources.

The deck focuses on utilizing mana acceleration through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Noble Hierarch to ramp into powerful creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Craterhoof Behemoth. It also includes a variety of utility creatures like Collector Ouphe and Reclamation Sage to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to control the board by leveraging its variety of creatures and spells, while also utilizing cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for key threats. The deck's strategy revolves around creating a strong board presence while disrupting opponents' game plans.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing a mix of disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Thoughtseize, along with powerful beaters like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, it aims to control the board and wear down the opponent's resources. Additionally, the deck includes various ways to generate card advantage and protect its key pieces, ensuring a consistent and efficient game plan. With a strong mana base and versatile sideboard options, it can adapt to different matchups and strategies.

This deck focuses on utilizing small aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares. The addition of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value with flicker effects and ETB abilities. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Overlord of the Balemurk and Stoneforge Mystic to increase the aggressiveness of the creatures. With cards like Aether Vial and Recruiter of the Guard, the deck aims to maintain board presence and control through a combination of creatures and disruption spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Skyclave Apparition to handle threats, while also utilizing Aether Vial for tempo advantage. The deck also incorporates powerful white removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with opposing creatures. Additionally, the inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in the long game. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and close out the game quickly with aggressive threats.

This deck aims to control the board through disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach while deploying efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Barrowgoyf to quickly close out the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and tempo, while cards like Brainstorm and Daze help manipulate draws and protect key threats. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's aggressive game plan, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistency. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and apply pressure to win the game quickly.

The deck aims to quickly and efficiently mill through the entire library to win the game via alternative win conditions such as Thassa's Oracle or Goblin Charbelcher. The deck includes a mix of creatures, spells, and rituals to achieve this goal, with high-risk high-reward strategies and the potential for explosive turns. The deck also includes disruption and protection spells to ensure the combo can go off smoothly. The key is to carefully manage resources and timing to execute the combo successfully and outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the necessary combo pieces to win the game in one explosive turn. By utilizing fast mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, along with powerful self-mill and graveyard recursion effects, the goal is to mill the entire library and win with cards like Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pact of Negation and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to win the game as quickly and efficiently as possible through a high-risk, high-reward strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly get out powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, or Omniscience. By cheating these big creatures into play early, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond. The deck includes a mix of acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, as well as card draw and counterspells to help protect the combo. The mana base consists of a mix of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Murktide Regent adds additional threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck is designed to efficiently interact with the opponent's spells and creatures while maintaining card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Narset, Parter of Veils. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, and efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's plays with cards like Stifle and Force of Will, while generating card advantage and selection with Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic allows for the tutoring of powerful equipment like Kaldra Compleat and Meteor Sword, while also providing additional value with Pre-War Formalwear. Additionally, the deck has a land denial strategy with Wasteland and Karakas.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a variety of counterspells and removal spells, while also drawing cards and generating value through cards like Quantum Riddler, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent, ultimately locking them out of the game with cards like Back to Basics and Teferi, Time Raveler. The inclusion of Containment Priest also provides additional disruption against graveyard-based strategies. The deck's mana base is designed to support its heavy blue and white spellcasting requirements.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using Cloudpost lands and to eventually play powerful colorless spells and creatures such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy while utilizing cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Stock Up to draw cards and maintain card advantage. The goal is to quickly assemble a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts, particularly with the help of Emry, Lurker of the Loch, to generate mana quickly and efficiently. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer, along with powerful artifacts like Urza's Saga. The deck also includes disruption through cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor, while also providing card draw and selection with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast. With a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts, this deck aims to quickly establish board presence and control the game.

Utilizing a combination of low-cost artifacts and efficient creatures, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a relentless stream of threats. By leveraging powerful artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Urza's Saga alongside aggressive creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Kappa Cannoneer, this deck can apply pressure from the early turns of the game. With the ability to disrupt opponents with cards like Force of Will and Pithing Needle while maintaining a steady flow of threats, this deck aims to maintain a strong tempo and close out games quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble an aggressive board presence using artifact creatures and artifact-based cards, while disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga provide recursion and additional artifact value. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient threats and disruptive elements, utilizing the synergy between artifacts and blue spells to control the game and secure a win.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a lock on the game by using artifacts to control the opponent's resources and limit their options. By utilizing cards such as Trinisphere, Chalice of the Void, and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence. The inclusion of powerful artifact creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provide additional win conditions, allowing the deck to close out the game once it has established control.

The deck revolves around utilizing a variety of powerful control spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. By efficiently answering threats with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will, the deck aims to stall the game until it can establish dominant board presence with powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Solitude. The mana base is built to provide access to all necessary colors and also includes some utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas to deal with problematic permanents.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and using powerful combat abilities to overwhelm opponents. Utilizing a mix of efficient threats like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls, along with disruption like Swords to Plowshares and Static Prison, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional value and finishers, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer reach and versatility. The deck's mana base is streamlined for consistency, with options for both aggression and defense.

The deck focuses on using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will to control the tempo of the game while playing aggressive threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps generate card advantage and Brazen Borrower provides versatility. The combination of efficient removal like Fatal Push and Snuff Out along with versatile threats creates a deck that can quickly pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's dual color requirements while also being able to interact with the opponent's lands with cards like Wasteland.

The main strategy of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats to pressure them. Using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Daze, you can strip away your opponent's key cards while maintaining tempo with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and utility, while cards like Fatal Push and Snuff Out help deal with opposing threats. Overall, this deck aims to control the game early on and finish off the opponent quickly with a barrage of attacks.

The deck revolves around efficiently assembling the Doomsday combo to win the game. It uses cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, while also utilizing powerful disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Barrowgoyf provide additional card advantage and pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to set up a winning Doomsday pile with Thassa's Oracle or Barrowgoyf as a win condition. It also includes a small amount of creature threats like Murktide Regent for alternate win conditions and board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly set up and execute the combo using [[Doomsday]] along with cards like [[Thassa's Oracle]] and [[Barrowgoyf]] to win the game in one explosive turn. The deck aims to use efficient card selection and mana acceleration to assemble the combo pieces quickly while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like [[Force of Will]] and [[Daze]]. The deck also includes cards like [[Thoughtseize]] and [[Ponder]] for additional card selection and disruption, making it a fast and powerful combo deck in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this Aggro Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck aims to slow down its opponent's strategy and control the game with powerful cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Sundering Eruption. Furthermore, the deck utilizes fast mana acceleration with cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to quickly deploy threats and overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with strong Eldrazi creatures, using cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to apply constant pressure with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, while also utilizing disruption options like It That Heralds the End and Wastescape+Battlemage','','');">Wastescape Battlemage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the Eldrazi theme, with lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple providing additional benefits to the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm and disrupt the opponent. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void to shut down opposing spells, Lotus Petal to accelerate mana, and disruptive creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control. The mana base is optimized to reliably cast Eldrazi creatures, with lands like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple providing additional mana acceleration. The deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive Eldrazi creatures. Utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, as well as disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly building a threatening board presence. With a mix of mana acceleration and land destruction, the deck seeks to outpace the opponent and deal massive amounts of damage quickly. Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple provide additional mana acceleration, allowing for powerful plays early in the game.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggressive creatures like Eldrazi Linebreaker and Glaring Fleshraker, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly through cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith, allowing for big threats like Reality Smasher and Sire of Seven Deaths to come down early. The inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Kozilek's Command helps to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command. By utilizing efficient mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, this deck aims to quickly deploy its threats while also having control elements like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes some utility lands like Wasteland and Eye of Ugin to further support its aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of card draw, counterspells, removal, and creatures to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to generate card advantage through Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, Thundertrap Trainer, and Baleful Strix while also providing threats with Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Sheoldred's Edict, as well as graveyard recursion with Reanimate. It's a versatile control deck that can adapt to different matchups and disrupt the opponent's game plan effectively.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient and disruptive spells like Brainstorm, Daze, Force of Will, Lightning Bolt, and Thoughtseize to control the game while deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Nethergoyf to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mishra's Bauble to keep up with the opponent's resources. By combining disruption, aggression, and card advantage, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on putting early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Barrowgoyf, backed up by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to control the game and finish off opponents quickly. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent casting of spells. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of fast aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on using the Show and Tell combo to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play early. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps to accelerate the combo by reducing the cost of spells. The One Ring provides additional mana acceleration. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and protection spells like Veil of Summer to protect the combo. Omniscience allows for casting spells for free, while Stock Up and Brainstorm help with card filtering and drawing. The deck aims to quickly put big threats into play and overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently mill through your entire library to win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. This is achieved by using a combination of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Chrome Mox, along with discard and sacrifice effects to get your creatures into the graveyard. Once you have milled through your deck, you can use cards like Narcomoeba and Reanimate to bring back key pieces and secure the win. The deck aims to win the game before your opponent has a chance to respond.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty, Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Griselbrand, and then bring them back to the battlefield using cards like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Shallow Grave. The deck is focused on exploiting the graveyard as a resource for powerful reanimation plays, with cards like Faithless Looting and Thoughtseize to help set up the graveyard and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes fast mana generation with Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to quickly reanimate creatures and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to quickly bring back high-impact creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty. It also includes cards like Brainstorm and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient reanimation strategy while controlling the game with counterspells and disruptive elements like Wasteland.

The main concept of this Mono Red Combo deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Ruby Medallion, Desperate Ritual, and Seething Song to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wish','','');">Burning Wish. The deck also includes cards like Wrenn's Resolve and Storm of Memories to control the board and protect your combo pieces. Bonus Round can help double the effectiveness of your spells, while Jeska's Will and Rite of Flame provide additional mana acceleration. The goal of this deck is to assemble your combo pieces and overwhelm your opponent with powerful spells and abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to cheat out powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By quickly getting these creatures onto the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to respond. The deck also includes cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support the deck's fast-paced strategy and enable it to consistently pull off its combo.

The main strategy of this deck is to cheat powerful cards into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The key cards in the deck are Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Omniscience. By quickly getting these cards into play, the deck can overwhelm the opponent with high-impact threats and win the game before the opponent has a chance to respond. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Ponder to help find the necessary combo pieces and protect the combo from disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent with efficient counterspells and removal spells. It aims to control the game by keeping the opponent on the back foot while applying pressure with evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck's game plan is to maintain tempo and card advantage by utilizing card selection through Brainstorm and Ponder, while also using burn spells like Lightning Bolt to finish off the opponent. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's low-curve aggressive strategy.

The main concept of the deck is to have a fast and aggressive approach, utilizing powerful creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption elements like Daze and Force of Will to control the game and protect your creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistency and efficiency, with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure, react to threats effectively, and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing cheap, efficient spells and creatures to pressure the opponent early on. It aims to control the board with disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will while quickly deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent. The deck also includes card selection and manipulation tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws and maintain tempo. The mana base is optimized for casting spells quickly, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the board with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counter spells and removal. It also includes card draw and filtering to ensure consistency in drawing into threats and answers. Additionally, the inclusion of big threats like Murktide Regent allows for a strong finisher if the game goes long.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost, aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes control elements like counterspells such as Daze and Force of Will to protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy, using cards like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to remove threats. The mana base consists of lands that can produce both blue and red mana, allowing for consistency in casting spells and activating abilities.
